name: Sort DAT
description: The Sort DAT will sort table DAT data by row or column.
summary: The Sort DAT will sort table DAT data by row or column.

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.label: Sort
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Sort  will sort table  data by row or column.
sortDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  sortmethod -  - Determines how the table will be sorted.

 colname - Sort rows using the column specified under the  parameter. colindex - Sort rows using the column specified under the  parameter. colpreserve - Uses the current ordering of the input. This sorting allows parameters such as Preserve First, Unique Output, and Reverse Output to be applied to the original input. rowname - Sort columns using the row specified under the  parameter. rowindex - Sort columns using the row specified under the  parameter. rowpreserve - Uses the current ordering of the input. This sorting allows parameters such as Preserve First, Unique Output, and Reverse Output to be applied to the original input.
		
  name - When using  Specify Row/Column Name, specify the name in this parameter. If the sort name does not find a match, the output will be unsorted.


		
  index - When using  Specify Row/Column Index, specify the index in this parameter. If the sort index is -1 or out of bounds, the output will be unsorted.


		
  order -  - Determines the type of sorting.

 alpha - Use alphabetical sorting. Numbers are treated as characters, sorted by their ASCII values. alphanum - Use alphanumerical sorting. nums - Use numerical sorting. Characters are all treated as 0, incoming order is preserved. random - Randomly sorts the table, uses random  parameter below.
		
  seed - The random seed when  is set to .


		
  ignorecase - Ignores case sensitivity when Sort Order is set to Alphabetical or Alphabetical with Numbers.


		
  preservefirst - Does not resort the first row or column (depending if  is set to Rows or Columns).


		
  unique -  - Remove duplicate rows/column entries in the sorted row/column.

 off - single - entire -
		
  reverse - Reverses the sort order.





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. frag - glsl - html - md - py - rtf - tsv - txt - vert - xml - languageext - pick extension from DATs script language. customext - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.



 -

Extra Information for the Sort  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Number of rows in this . - Number of columns in this .
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.

DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Sort_DAT&oldid=24309"
		Category: DATs
